snippet: Former Prime Minister Milos Zeman won 24.21 percent of the vote, giving him a narrow lead over Foreign Minister Karel Schwarzenberg, an ardent supporter of the European Union and the United States.
abstract: Former Czech Republic Prime Min Milos Zeman and current Foreign Min Karel Schwarzenberg will face each other in country's presidential runoff, in first direct popular vote for head of state in country.

byline.contributor: Hana de Goeij contributed reporting from Prague.

lead_paragraph: Former Prime Minister Milos Zeman won 24.21 percent of the vote, giving him a narrow lead over Foreign Minister Karel Schwarzenberg, an ardent supporter of the European Union and the United States.

headline.main: Rivals in Czech Presidential Runoff Support Warmer Ties With Europe
headline.print_headline: Rivals in Czech Presidential Runoff Support Warmer Ties With Europe
